Transcription_Text: Good evening! Welcome to a very special episode of Talks Machina: The Critmas episode! I am your host, Brian Wayne Foster, and my guests tonight include this guy, this guy, this girl, this guy, that girl, and this guy. All that and more tonight on Talks Machina. Hit it, Denise.|(Talks Machina intro music)|Well, folks. It's that time of year again, where we pick up the pieces of what we spilled the year before. Sometimes you have to sweep it under the rug. Sometimes that rug is bearskin-colored.|Sometimes-- are we really just going? (laughter)
Marisha caught in flagrante delicto!
She's going after the presents underneath the tree.
Keep Christmas going!
Critmas! Say it right.
Praise be to Jesus Crit.
Guys. How is everybody doing?
Good, how are you?
Wonderful. Merry Critmas, everyone.
It's the holiday season.
We've got gifts. We've got the spirit of Christmas. There's a light snowfall. When we were driving up, did you guys see that?
That was ash, something was on fire.
Yeah, so the Warner Brothers tower was being drizzled with snow.
Drizzled?
We'll cut it out.|(laughter)|Is the music too loud, Denise?
Yes.
No.
Don't you sass me, Denise.|(laughter)

When she has spoken, she has spoken. It's over after that. Tonight, we're going to do Critmas on the show. There's not going to be a Critical Role on Thursday the 22nd. Instead, we're going to open our Critmas presents and hang out, just have fun, and towards the end of the episode, we're going to play our What Does Critical Role Mean To You? videos that you guys have sent in, so stick around for that. Yes, very excited! Before we get going, I didn't have time to send in a video, because I missed the deadline. Instead, I'm going to read my Critmas letter to you.
Oh no.
Batten down the hatches!
What do you mean, Oh no?
Hang on, wait. Can I repour my glass of wine that spilled at the very top of the episode?
You absolutely can. Matt? How was your week?
My week was crazy. I'm looking forward--
I'm looking forward.
Yeah, not backward, but that direction. No.|Yeah. Hi.
Did you see Marisha pop into his frame for a second, then pop back out? (laughter)
Marisha, if you've finished up in there, you can also dust in the dining room, and the bathrooms need to be cleaned as well.
Is that a knock at the door?
Uncle--
--David Bowie? I don't know.
Nice, but too soon.
Are you trying to save this episode? It's too early to save this episode.
We could totally start over, but the shittiness of this fits the last five episodes so well.
We're on brand right now.
We are hashtag on brand.|Like I said, I wasn't able to send in a video, because I missed the deadline, but I did write you guys a Critmas letter that I'm going to read to get us started.
Is it in screenplay format?
It is not.
Damn.

But I am translating it from Latin. It says, "Guys--" That's the Latin word for friends.|(laughter)|"Guys, we all know 2016 had its fair share of ups and downs. For instance, an example of a down moment would be every moment before there was a Talks Machina. To contrast that, an example of an up moment would be every moment after there was a Talks Machina. This holiday season, I'm thankful for every single one of you guys. Ashley." (laughter)|"Matt, Marisha--" These aren't in any particular order, I promise.
You better say my name next.

"Travis, for sure, Liam, Laura, Taliesin's on here, Denise, Amandine's on here, Eddie, Max, and Sam-- times when I think about Critical Role and my Critical Role family, a single trait sticks out in my mind: their kindness. For instance, they were kind enough to offer me this job by sending a courier to my house to hand-deliver me a note.|Surely, they must have been overwhelmed with work, auditions, parenting, and insurance fraud-- Sam.|Surely, they did not send a courier because this news seemed too unimportant to deliver personally.|No, I mean, there's only eight of them."
Did we really send a courier?
Laura!

"I took it as an act of kindness. That evening, at dusk, I sat in front of my house, holding that note, almost afraid of its contents.|There, among the stray cats and drifters, I finally gathered the strength to read that note. I held it close to the barrel fire I had just cooked my dinner over, and I opened the note. The first thing I noticed was it was quite short. The second thing I noticed about this note offering me the job was that it wasn't even handwritten. But that night, my life would change, for the note read, very simply, "Hardwick passed. You're up. Travis." (laughter)
So true.
Listen, I have illegible writing.

But thank you, guys. Years from now, when I'm living off the money I make at conventions in Paraguay and robbing the elderly, I'll be grateful. I'll always remember where I got my start. My first gig. That gig was the gig I do after my contract here is up. Please contact my reps for hosting opportunities after the 31st of-- we'll just say later. But thank you, Critical Role, for the opportunity to ask you guys questions about yourselves." (cheering and laughter)
It's what the Critmas spirit is all about.
Cheers, guys.
Next, our musical guests, the Stray Cats. I'm excited that you happen to know them.
Taliesin, big fan of the Stray Cats. Okay, let's begin.
What are we doing?
Is this where we start opening things? What are we doing?
Let's open things. Oh, we're going to play the intro?
Yeah, roll the opening for the opening.
Yeah. Let's roll the wrong clip of Sam.|(laughter)
Is there ever a wrong clip of Sam?
Is there ever a right one?
How does this work? You grab them, and we talk about who sent them out?
Usually, we talk amongst ourselves.
I want Marisha to put some nail wraps on me.
We just figured we could have a classic Critmas powwow.
Maybe we should go around the room while we're opening and just say one thing we're grateful about.
God, I'm going to barf all over you. Do not make us do this shit.
How about we say one thing that we like about Brian?
That's even harder.
At least you won't have to worry about taking up too much time.
You want to go first, Travis?
I like that, and then a hard cut to Christmas gifts we opened.|(laughter)
All right, let's begin. I'm ready.
I, for one, appreciate that Travis's letter got to you before the restraining order did.
That's true. You were able to head that one off at the pass.
A little bit of backpedalling on our part.
There's a P.S. to that story, by the way.|The courier's name? Was fucking Glenn.
Yeah.
God damn it, Glenn.
It was Glenn, guys. Anyway, keep going.|(laughter)|For anyone who has not seen the show, they're like--
The fuck?

What I like about you, Brian, is that the first time you came-- well, I guess it wasn't the first time. The first time you came to set after you got this job? You made us all Old Fashioneds during Critical Role.
I did.
You make a mean Old Fashioned, and I wish that kept going.

I'm here every Thursday. I could keep doing it. The only problem is they're quite tasty and then by half-time, maybe, everybody could be a little drippy. We'll just limit to four hours? You could do two. Do one at the break. That's a good enough amount of time.
Don't look at me! I'm not allowed to drink during any of the games.
You drink, what is that? Tang?
By the way, that's a self-imposed rule.|No one else puts that on him.
No. I have way too much to concentrate on every time we do an episode. I can't drink.
Still a self-imposed rule.
Ladies and gentlemen, french horns are back.
What I like about Brian, is Brian is brave enough, and bold enough, to bring the french horns back for the holiday season.|(cheering)
Please don't turn them off. Oh, okay.
That's not french horns.

I'm thankful for the day that you showed me a video from the wedding of me when I barely knew you, walking by, and me scowling or grimacing at you. You see this? Here, I'm going to walk by and watch what you do.
Did you do that?
I don't remember it.
Yeah, I walked by, and he was like--
That was probably a reaction to your skinny pants and my admiration/envy.
They were skinny back then, too. I was like a size zero. Yeah.
Now you're a size hero.|(laughter)
This is why we don't let him drink.
I make the shitty jokes on this show!
Sorry.
I make the jokes that people hate.

I admire the fact that you've overcome your handicap, which we all know is that he's smooth down there. It's like a Ken doll. There's no genitalia. It's just shiny and plastic. It's just, there's nothing. Just nothing there. But you've somehow overcome that and had a relatively normal life.
Nothing I can say. Right now, I can see tweets, I can see Tumblr, I can see Reddit, I can see people showing up at my house, so I'm just going to say thank you, Sam.
I can see fan art, weirdly.
I can see fan art. I'm just going to say thank you.
I am thankful for your ability to wear the top button of your collared shirt closed, whether you're wearing a tie or not.
Thank you. I do not know how to tie a tie, however.
Is that a clip-on?
That's a clip-on.
Denise had to tie my tie tonight.
She did a good job. I mean, it's a little--
I crawled in here, and I said, "Denise, I'm so sorry for how I've treated you." And she said, "I'm so sorry, remind me who you are, again?" (laughter)
Do you have a key card?
Didn't pass the background check.|(laughter)|Nope. Someone tagged me in a Reddit thing today, and they were like, "I love how shady Brian is." (laughter)
That was my compliment!
Please tell me that's on your business card: "Brian Wayne Foster. Shady."
It's more of a, "Meet me out back." That's all it says. "Meet me out back."
Yeah, I could totally give those out to girls at bars. "Meet me out back." Nobody's going to think anything of it.
You definitely shouldn't do that. You shouldn't be hitting on girls at bars.
It's on his LinkedIn profile.
I sell shirts out of my van. You know that.|People are always coming out to my car.
It says, "Meet me out back." And on the other side of the card, it says, "Steak house." Meet me at the out back, steak house. It's great. It's a terrible joke. I feel bad for making it.
So five days until Christmas, and then ten days until New Years, from tonight.
Yeah, from tonight! Because it's the 20th.
Christmas from tonight. Tuesday, December 20th--
Is right now.
The night of our lord, Tuesday.
We've had the Thordak fight.
We just rolled all our new characters yesterday.
It was a crazy night.
It didn't go at all how I expected.
In a way, though, it was fitting. It was a fitting end.
I thought so, too.
The Scanlan/Grog love interest thing, I was not prepared for that. It was really--
Okay, here's my top three moments from the Thordak episode: Taliesin rolled very well.
I did.
These were the things that surprised me: Taliesin rolled very well. Sam knows a lot more Melissa Etheridge songs that we all thought.
And we thought he knew a lot!
And we thought he knew a karaoke binder's width. Number three-- this was a weird one.|Marisha got blamed for some shit.|(laughter)
Did not see that coming.
Thanks, Keyleth.
That's not the internet I know.
Not today. Not here.
I'm hoping for some of that to change in 2017. Bright new future.
Oh, you know what? Since our last episode, if you haven't been here-- Travis hasn't been here since the first episode. We lifted the boycott.|He's back. Hey, last week on the show, a week ago--
You got to fill me in, because I don't watch this shit.
I wouldn't either. Don't like the host. A week ago tonight, Will Friedle was on the show.
Yeah.
He threw some shade down about your Cowboys, and my Cowboys, and Laura's Cowboys, and my uncle Bill's Cowboys.
Yeah, I heard.
Yeah, he's a Deflatriots fan.
No, I know, it's okay, He lives really close to us. I visited him that night.
This is now your time, this is your-- Equal time, right?
Is this bear pelt?!
Sorry, Trinket.

Yeah. I stood in front of his dark bedroom, breathing heavily, and then put my hand over his now-wife's mouth, and said, "Shh, it's time for a conversion therapy session. You will love the Cowboys." And he said, "No, I don't want to, I don't want to love winners, Tom Brady is the best." I-- is nobody else following what I'm--
No, I'm so delighted, we're all on board, keep going.
We're talking about the Old West, right?
Yeah.
I thought we were talking about Mike Pence.
I thought we were talking about Knock Knock.
Yes. Yeah, that's it.
Let's open presents.
Let's. Please. Open presents. Please.
Yeah, let's open presents.
How are we going to do this? Someone go and get them.
I got some on the end.
I hear a jingle of hooves on the roof.
Oh my goodness, it's the FBI.
Where's the presents?
Ho ho ho, hands on the ground.|(laughter)|Trying to make it festive.
Bag those two, for sure.
Just bring anything.
Somebody was cooking meth this year.
Sam is sponsoring this episode of Talks Machina.
I'm sponsoring this episode?
Who decided to sponsor our December 20th episode of Talks Machina?
I have no idea. This is your show. I'm actually-- I'm still stunned that we pay you for this.
This is for Critical Role.
That's interesting to learn myself. I was not aware of it.
I have a present for the group from Scott McLean.
Scott McLean.
Oh, it's fragile.|(paper rustling)
Let's trash this place.
Yeah!
This is just-- What is it?
I don't know yet.
It's a circle.
It's a dragon!
Whoa!
There's a Bigby's Hand.
Bigby's Hand, they are all made out of paper.
But it's not paper mache?
No, it's straight-up paper.
How did that not get crushed?
That's really fucking nuts.
Those are beautiful.
Those are awesome.
Those are great, thank you.
Scott McLean.
I've got something from... There's no name!
Just open it. We need to keep going.
Maybe there's a note inside.
Someone get a close-up on Taliesin, Denise.
Travis. Me. Liam. Marisha. And Sam.
And there's a little note.
And Matt, and the rest of the cast. Sorry, Taliesin.
The rest of the cast is just Taliesin.
Matt and me.
These are from James Hoelscher, or tazman5296 in chat on Twitter.
How did you know?
Oh, he sent my boots of haste?
Yeah, he sent that ivy circlet that I used to have.
Oh, the arrows!
His brother and him also made donations to the Prescott chapter of Big Brothers Big Sisters.
Oh, that's great. That?s really cool.
What have we got? What is this stuff? Tiny things.
He says he's sent stuff before.
That is awesome.
Thank you.
Oh yeah, it's like the spiritual successor to Three Wolf Moon.
Oh my God, that's glorious.
We are going camping in these shirts.
We are so going camping.
That's a tough-looking bear.
Is the bear wearing a torc?
He is, it's like if he got awakened.
I'm pretty sure all my shirts could kick your shirts' ass.
(high-pitched whistle) I got reeds for my shawm.
It's a flute the size of Scanlan's penis.
It's the wrong shape.
Thank you, James! Sorry about that.
If you pass out, I hope you'll still be blowing it.
All right.
Thank you, James.
We'll cut that out.
This is going to be heavily edited. The final file is just going to be six minutes long.
It's going to be everybody going, "Hey guys, cut."
More shirts from Rebecca Sidenburger.
She's Ryuti76 in the chat.
Is what? Say it again, please?
Ryuti76 in chat.
(singing) I'm the one holding the shirts so I get to find the right size. They're shirts made--
Oh, because she made them!
Yeah. She designed them, it's the D&D symbol with our names.
This is so cool!
That's really cool!
How many shirts are there?
A lot.
She did her thesis on Critical Role.
Wait, what? Was this a high school thesis or a college thesis?
No, she graduated with a BFA in graphic design, dude.
She did her thesis on us?
Yeah!
She got a C+.
She passed. It was a pass/fail class.
Gang, gang, gang. The smallest sizes are mediums so the ladies will be getting the mediums.
Thank you.
You also take the one for Ash.
She says she's sorry if they aren't the appropriate sizes. She wanted them to be a surprise so she had to guess.
What's a BFA? I have a BFF.
Is it me? Is it me?
Can we let them know that we got their letter? Can I say it? This is a lovely letter from tazman5296. Dude, thank you so much. Thank you so much for the Big Brothers Big Sisters.
That is so sweet! Thank you, Rebecca.
I think we're shy one unless I missed one in the box.
I've got to get one, got to have one.
Let me see.
These are a good size.
Everyone knows she'll cut them up.
Thank you!
No. No. Denise! She tricked me!
What?
Nothing, it's fine. Travis saw it.
Oh wow, look at all these things over here! What is this?
Go, fire it up!
Oh, wow.

This is from a Critter named AmniClerk @Stories_nDreams. It's an embossed Critical Role-y card that she made. It says, "May the happiness of family, the joys of friendship, and the warmth of love surround you this season. Also, fuck you, Brian." That's weird.
Oh my god.
That's so strange.
"For all the love and support you've given myself and the rest of the Critter legion, thank you, Happy Winter's Crest and beyond." And inside are--
Whoa, oh my god.
Oh wait, they light up. They might be ornaments.
Oh my god, they're so pretty.
They do light up, they've got dice on them, they look handmade. They're amazing. One for Matt.|Liam. Taliesin.
Aw! I got a blue one.
They're little ornaments! Oh my god!
Let's put them on the tree!
I'm going to put Ashley's on the tree.
Put Ashley's on the tree.
Are they ornaments?
They're ornaments.
It's an ornament, okay, good. I'm going to put this on my tree, tonight.
Oh my gosh.
Aw, thank you.
Thank you!
Oh look, it has a little Percy. What great penmanship. Sorry, that was my immediate thought.
Oh my gosh! Hold on, hold on.
Also, I think there's some gifts here for the crew. They're like blue screens of death.
Wow!
Oh my god.
Oh my god. That is so cool.
That is amazing.
It says "Twitch has returned error, the universe broke. Please reboot." And it says #WeKnow.
Yeah, Taliesin has his hand out.
I have my hand out. I know, it's gone.
We know! Oh my god it says #WeKnow.
#WeKnow! Oh, that's so good. Clever! That's amazing!
Is that underwear, Liam?
Thanks for keeping us streaming.
Where do we put crew gifts, guys?
I'll take them.
Can I just open these chocolates, though?
Yeah, keep going. I want to eat some!
It's like carnival music.
I know, this music is really messed up right now.
This is a fan-favorite music. I'll have you know the French horns are the biggest thing to happen to this show since Sam was on.
Oh my god! I wanted to open the chocolates-- I thought they were for all of us, but it's just to me.
Wow, you're going to have to show us that letter to make sure that's true.

"Dear Laura. Last year, when Matt read that I like the dark chocolate truffles with Baileys filling, yours and Marisha's eyes indicated your interest. Therefore I address this box to you to share with the entire cast and crew." (laughter)
Did you hear her disappointment that she had to share it with me?
"I tried to donate to each person's individual charity over the course of the year." That's wonderful.
She's a greedy bastard.
It's from Paul Nelson, and he's claiming to be the official Critical Role forensic consultant.|I don't know why, but he is.
Awesome!
Does that mean he gets to cut us open when one of us finally dies?
It's weird that he saw that in your eyes, because all I see is darkness.
Thanks, Paul Nelson!

"Dear Critical Role, as an avid viewer of the show, and an occasional viewer of Matt and Marisha's Critmas periscopes, I seem to remember Marisha mentioning her love of leggings. My wife is a LuLaRoe consultant, her shop can be found on Facebook, and offered to send in a few pairs of leggings for the ladies." You can keep doing that, I don't mind, but massage if you're going to do it. These are six-- No, my ears, man. Six sets of leggings. Pick one.
They're soft, Marisha!
Are they comfy?
Ooh, I want these ones!
Remember that two are for Ashley.
Wait, there's six, and two of them are for Ashley?
She's not here, right?
That's true. That is true.
She's probably watching, though. Not right now, because it's not live.
What's good for Ashley? Ashley, which one's good for you?
You could ask her boyfriend!
I feel like these are good for Ashley.
I feel like those are actually good for Ashley
Those are good, also any of the other ones.
The corduroy patches.
She would take anything.

This is from Kane Velante, and she says, avid member of our show and all of the artistic masterpieces that people-- I don't want to read the whole letter because of time, but they basically gave new minis to Grog and--
Yeah, these are good too! Look at that. It looks just like you!
Wow!
It's got wings, motherfucker! Thank you!
That's true, I've been waiting for a "and then I fly away." We haven't had a "and then I fly away."
Guys, can we see him? This is legit.
It's pretty good, yeah, it's pretty great.
Hey, I have something here! Yeah, it's from my probation officer. No, I'm just kidding. Oh, it says "Liam." Liam, there's a note for you.
Is it from my second family in Nevada?
Hold on, let me skim through this. It says-- oh, you left your lights on outside.
Oh, thanks.
Oh, I know, I'm going to give this to Liam.
It is for Liam.
Yep, hold on, it's rubber-banded. "Don't go drinking with hobbits."
No promises.
With lyrics by people whose names I can't pronounce. And they sent this rubber band for Marisha.
Oh thanks, dude!
They sent this for-- is that the audiobooks? Is that what it is, CDs? Hold on, please accept these items as a token of my--

"Stunning dramatized BBC production of Tolkien's classic is presented in 13 hours on 13 compact discs. Starring Ian Holm, and featuring a cast of 25 performers, specially composed music and sound effects, in this beautifully packaged box said to be the perfect gift for every Tolkien fan." That's me!
This is from Jean Dewey, a.k.a.|elenoirproudfoot, thank you so much.
Bailey's truffle. That's what I want.
That looks so cool, thank you! Can I see the letter?
Yes, that's for you. I was just going to hand that to you.
I got one!
Oh, Travis has one!

"There isn't enough space to convey my thoughts, I am a novice Critter right now with hopes that I'll speed up to speed soon. Please accept this small token of appreciation with the warmest, awesome members of Critical Role. Warm regards, Aaron." It is a DVD copy of Critters.
Oh, the classic movie.
I actually did creature noises, and-- nah, I'm going to shut up.
You were ten.
I know. I'm a liar and a thief.
Wow! I think my mom may have worked on one of those, too. Of course she did.
Critters 3? Yeah.
Yeah, it sounds like something my mom would do. I'll double-check.
Who's opening next?

I've got one from Joe White at RPGenius, which is a 3D-printing company. He and his team apparently listen to us to pass the time as they're working on all their cool miniatures that they make. He said apparently we increase their productivity. And then he sent me-- which is good.|Work. Work harder! They sent Percy an in-game letter, which is really spectacular, from a citizen of Whitestone who was a tinkerer of his own. I'll put some quotes up later. He said that he sent-- this is a prototype of something they've been working on, and this is the only one they'll making of this scale.
What the heck?
But they sent a prototype of something.
It's a gun.
Oh my-- (exclamations of awe)
And it has a scope.
Does it spin?

Probably not, because it's 3D-printed, but I don't know. Actually, I'm going to find out.|I need to reassemble the scope at some point.|Let's find out if it-- no, it's designed to look like it spins but actually-- oh my god!
That's been engraved.
Yeah, in fact, that would work really well--
TSA won't have a problem with that at all.
No, TSA, they won't be like last time! This will not be like last time.

And here's the deal, too. Also, so we're aware going forward because I got this note handed to me from one of the producers. "Any gifts opened on the set can be chosen as set pieces by the host." So what it says here is starting with Taliesin's gun and then any of the gifts afterwards. It's a very long explanation. Article two, paragraph three. You got it. You got it, BFF. Whatever you need.
Oh, it needs a little leather strap, too. I want to do some stuff to it.
(singing) A little leather strap is what it needs!

This is from Melanie Gurran and she sent us seaglass that she has collected from the shores of Washington that is apparently lucky, and if we-- Taliesin. She said that they're lucky stones so that if we put them in our dice bag, maybe it would bring us good luck.
I like it even though she put Raishan on the freaking packaging!
Oh, Laura part two, because she knows.

And this is for Ashley--
What piece of music is this?
Oh, thank you! What did we get?

No, there's sheet music on the back of the card.
I read music. My tune actually goes (imitates guitar riff)
That was nice, baby.
That was from Splash.
Yeah, you can see it right there. That's my sheet music. You follow along in three-quarter-eighteenth's time in a D-minor major chord.
I'm so excited by it.

We also have a stack of letters here, which we're going to have to read off-stream. There's one from Jennifer Griffey, Joshua Luczac, Lena Hox, Megan Levon, Paige Megelly, Nicholas McGuire.|And this one, which I think Liam needs to read.

I followed some of that!
Es gibt Critical Role. Matt, ganz im Ernst.
Und Grog is the best.
I see my name.

UNICEF donation!

Oh that's funny, a packet of mayo!

They sent you mayonnaise.
Just a packet of mayo and a whole envelope.|(laughter)|It says, "I couldn't resist. Happy Critmas," but it's just this in this whole thing.|(laughter)

I have a really cool letter here from Thomas Dunwoody, who writes about how we helped him through his deployment and missing his friends and family, the show helped him get through that and he looks forward to hopefully meeting us at a Denver Comic Con sometime. As soon as he can find the list of everyone's favorite charities he promises to pledge $50 to each of them. Thank you.

If you do a search for the Critter's guide to Critmas on the Geek and Sundry website or do a Google search for Critter's guide to Critmas. You can find all our charities on there to support for this season. That is awesome! Thank you so much.
I have a gift from Mark Dunlap. Here is a little bit of art Mark did. He has made us a game.|This is the rulebook, as I gather, but look at this game board. Look at that!
Are you serious? That's really great!
I'm going to, if no one objects, I'm going to bring it home and look at it with my son.
Yeah!
It's super cool! It's getting wrinkled! I'm going to roll it.

Hey guys, this is for Matt and Marisha.|This comes from Cullin. I can't read this whole thing, but it's actually an engagement present.|How cool is that? Little context, there is a family tradition in Cullin's family that goes back to 850 C.E. in Germany where the engaged couple would be given one of these by everyone in the town.
I love how he hands it to me because he knows.
Yep.
I like this tradition. Why?
This is a good tradition.
This is a really cool letter. I'll let you guys read this.
This is how we settle arguments.
Yeah, exactly! That's why I handed it to her.
This is what we call marriage counseling.
You win. I'm sorry. I like how you're still German for no reason.
No, he said from a German background.|That's amazing, thank you! Whoever-- oh, a Norse colony in Germania.
But they originated in Germany, so you were right.
I like the notion that a bunch of Norse got to Germany and said, "Yeah, we're done."
Yeah, this is how we settle things now.
It's cold enough now. We're done.

This is for you, Matt. This is from Josh Miller or @JMiller1 on Twitter. We read your letter, Josh. It's amazing, and hopefully we do run into you, maybe in the near future. He said that this is for you, specifically.

I already see pentagrams, so I can hope it's to finally summon my patron. Oh, your guys' favorite! Hourglasses!
Yes! I love them!
That one is for shopping.
(laughs) That's so cool! Oh, it looks like it's a dark brown sand, too. It's got dragon heads pointing upwards. It's soul sand, from Minecraft.
This is nuts.
I'm so glad we all survived that dragon fight.
Yeah, that could have gone really poorly.
Well, except for Kima and Scanlan.
Thank you so much. I appreciate that.
There's another one, man.
There's another one?

Oh shit! This is a donation from Sarah Sutton to Mark Sutton. Wait, hang on.
Mark Sutton Ministries. They help out Haitian residents.

Ooh, these are all creepers!
Ooh, that looks like Zahra.
No, they go to Matt first.
Oh no, it's like a ghoul Zahra. It's zombie Zahra.

I actually have a really amazing letter here from Jade Rose from the UK, who is currently in New York City for the last few days of the holiday. Really, this sweet letter I've read most of it, I'm going to read the rest later on. Thank you so much. It's really sweet. Thank you for it.

Man, I got a thing from Shannon Pots all the way from, can't pronounce it, Republic of Korea. I teach my students to embrace what makes them different and weird. I share my love of D&D, Harry Potter, Doctor Who, showing that they should be proud of who they are." Loves 826LA teaching kids to be resourceful proud and accept themselves, their faults, and to always be the best they can be. She's included a baby green dragon that she made. It was needle felted. "I hope that you all enjoyed it. Made with wool fibers and a fuzzy needle, Merry Christmas." Thank you, Shannon @Shannon_Pots. You're the best.|Thanks for all you do, teaching the kids!
I want to put him on the tree, too!

Also known as @madqueenmomo. She's one of our prolific artists.

@madqueenmomo was what I was going to say next. "Wanted to give you all a big thank you for constantly inspiring artists everywhere weekly." The artists are the inspiring ones, these guys aren't. In this box you will find a studio pouch dice bag filled with sharpies, markers, and sketching pencils for everyone. I've also included a tiny sketchbook."
That's so cool.
Oh my god!
They're so cute!
Wow.
Oh my god!
Keyleth!
What are the things inside?
What's inside are sketchbooks. Monica, thank you so much.
Grog in a Cowboys jersey on the little notebook inside.|(noises of delight)
They all have sketchbooks in them.
Oh, wow!
This is so amazing! I'm so happy right now.
Look! She did short-haired Keyleth.

This is going to be my new journal.
Look at all that anime.
I really like anime version of us.|They're really cute.
They're the cutest!

Please accept this gift as a patronage for your outstanding work on the show and your gracious love towards the community. Much love, Shepherd. Open the box.

Enjoy your box.

It's a shame that those bracelets are grafted into your flesh.
Pass it around, let's see it.

Cool.

What's inside?

I hope it's teeth because it can then go to my teeth collection.

I have it powdered. I put it in your drink every week. Slowly I am getting inside of you.

Finland chocolate?
Finland chocolate. That's the best Scandinavian country for chocolate.

That?s pretty cute.
That's clever. That's really clever. You can actually have a superior healing potion ready to go in a bag.

It's because you've never been healed in your life.
It's never been an issue. It must be nice--
(singing) It must be nice, it must be nice--
(singing) --to have 700 hit points.

This is from Rob Ramshaw: "Hello, Liam. My 16-year-old daughter Rhianna and I used to enjoy watching Critical Role together. Used to, you ask? Therein lies the story. You see, last year Rhi was accepted by Rotary Club of America to represent them as an exchange student in Taiwan. I wanted to share something special with her for the last months she's still in the US. My 18-year-old son, Logan, suggested we watch Critical Role together.|Good advice. So we started watching and immediately fell in love with the show. We even made up characters of our own and pretended they were hirelings who stayed in the background. Way too soon, August 2016 came around, Rhi had to leave for Taiwan. While she was in the barnyard, a couple of ravens decided to chase our tom turkey out of the feed pile. He took exception and a scuffle went down. Rhi broke up the fight and scolded the ravens. When she looked down she saw both the turkey and raven had lost some feathers.|She gave me the turkey feather for my hat and sent you the raven feather because you play the raven paladin. So here is your prize for keeping me and my daughter entertained for the last year. A raven feather." Thank you.
I just read the letter from Jani Malkki over in Finland. Thank you so much. This is really sweet.
It's another short story from @Tiamat_ZX on Twitter, who I love. Thank you so much. I will read it when I get home.

There's some stuff here for you guys.|(laughter)|It's weird that Max laughs at all that stuff when he knows how professional I am. This is from a guy named Matt Miller-- Matthew Miller. Box Machina.

Blue poop, take a shot. Everybody at home, it's time to take a shot.

That's a really solid poop.
How many do you get, Sam?
I've gotten a dozen or so, but this poop might be the the best poop I've ever gotten.
Are you going to sleep with that poop tonight, Sam?
You should sleep with that poop on your chest.
I will. I'm going to Cleveland steamer myself with this tonight.
Okay, so this dice set is actually Reya's first dice set they ever had.
That's pretty awesome.
That's really sweet. Thank you so much. I love this.
Who's next?
For Ashley.
Great. It's going in the bag.

You're on it, Sam, so obviously--
Too easy.

Merry Critmas.

Someone donated to the Nature Conservancy, and I got a turtle. I don't know who this is from. Oh, jeez. They got this bookmark for you, Sam.

If you read books to yourself, I would watch that.

Thank you, @dutchcritter. Your Gilmore-themed leather bag based off of your paladin's LARP tabard is awesome! And I like your little note at the back here. I think it's very true, so thank you so much. That's really sweet.

Oh, there's another engagement present! "Matt and Marisha, hi! You might remember us from Critmas last year. We sent you the Tolkien-style wood-burned map."

"We wanted to send something else to say 'Congratulations on your engagement.' We know you guys love Avatar. So this is--" and then she tells me what it is, but I want you to open it.

Okay!

And it's an Iroh quote. Iroh's the best.

This is from Michael W. Crabtree says, "Hi, Critical Role cast. I want to thank you for the amazing journey. I used these a lot during my teens dabbed with Pathfinder, blah blah blah," Oh, man. "Vex's death felt real. Being a twin myself, I recognised the distance willing to go to protect my sister. I'd like to thank Matt for making DM Tips and DMs Guild classes. Three campaigns?
Three. He says, "The blood hunter lycan order have been a joy to play."

Wow, that's a lot of terms that I don't even understand. "Critical Role has inspired me to channel my originality and thank you for letting me play with my seven-year-old daughter. Crabtree A.K.A-- How do you pronounce that?

"Liam, your embracing of the Raven Queen was by far my favorite part in your game."

Finally! True accurate to the game!
Good focus pulling, by the way.
Cool! I like to think that he's got Whisper and the dragon sword.
Who should box these?
These should go back in the box so they don't get damaged.
I'll take them. I'll put them on the shelf.
I have a present here from Rob? It just says "From Rob." Thank you, Rob!
Hey, my name's Rob!
Could've been from Glenn.
Awesome presents in the mail!

Whoa!

That is from Rob Green. "Merry Christmas, Merry Critmas, Christmas, Happy Hanukkah, and Happy Holidays. I hope this holiday finds you well and with your loved ones. I've got a lot of stuff from Valerie Thompson. She wrote, number one, a manuscript that she said Taliesin should read first, because you love to read. She made a bunch of bear paw stickers for me! And then she made a dragonscale pendant for each person because she's a dragonborn in her campaign. You got a platinum one, Matthew. And Ashley got a white one.

They're pretty!
You're very olfactory today.
I feel like you could eat this.
They're clay pendants. She made them!
I'm pretty sure it's like taffy.
No, don't eat it!
We can make them into chokers!
(gobbling sounds) I'm a turkey!
Really? She spent all this time on this, and you're going to make it into a turkey wattle?
That's a very funny turkey wattle.

"Dear Matt and Marisha, congratulations on your engagement. I'm so happy for you two. Wish you both all the love and happiness in the world.|May all your dice rolls be natural 20s." Maybe hers. That's so sweet!|It's got a little pin with hearts on it!
Brian Wiggly Foster? Is that a vacuum-sealed pack?

Guys, there's a note here that says: "Here is a labor of love. Laura used to do quilts, and probably could've done better, but it was made with all the best interest and it was the first time piecing shapes. The squares were printed by Matt Abernathy, and the design is by Kenneth Wriggles."

I can't read the last sentence until Denise brings me a scissors or a knife so I can open this-- oh, wait! Sorry, Denise! Sorry, Denise. I have to put Ashley down. All right girls, and Liam. Here it comes.
Is this empty?
Spread it out!
Whoa!
"The star represents the star of the Cowboys. Sorry for not putting the line and the paws for Trinket. We love you all."

Look at this list of people, you guys.

This is a real deal!
These are the same people who did the one for us, too?
This is the amount of people that worked on this quilt.
Who is it for? Who gets to have it? Because it looks like a whole lot of me and Grog.
It's you and Grog.
I'm there because I'm her brother.
Baby, it's ours! Our quilt!
It's you and Travis's, because it's got the Cowboys and the thing for Trinket.
I know where this is going! This is going in the guest bedroom so that your guests can sleep on your pictures of you every time they visit.
Oh, Craven Edge! Guys, we can still go get Craven Edge, I'm just saying.
I know where he is.
Put that in the guest room so I can sleep on it when I pass out drunk at your guys' house.
This is going to be my TV-watching comfy throw.
You want to wake up and just have Grog's face right there.
I often do.
This is so amazing!
It must've taken hours! Days!
This would've taken so long.
That's a lot of work.
Really, really awesome.
I live with a quilter. That's a lot of work.
I mean, look at these! These are the teeniest little stitches I've ever seen!
He doesn't want to admit it, but Travis is actually crying right now.
Real human boy tears, too. Not those old, wooden ones.
No, I ain't crying. Wow! Look at the list of names!
Read all of them.
Ready? I'll read them all in one second.|(screams)
Critical Role Scanlan got a letter from the World Wildlife Fund, asking for donations.|(laughter)|This was technically part of Critmas.
What we asked people to do, we said ask for a donation in Scanlan's name.
They suggest I donate $55, $69, or $85, and in the spirit of Critmas, I'll consider that. They really want this!
Oh my god, did you get stamps?
They're not usable stamps. They're just stickers.
Hey! They knew.
So you have to give a donation and pay for the postage.
Nope! "No postage necessary if mailed in the United States."
You have to leave the United States.
That is fantastic.
Thank you, guys, for thinking of me.|(laughter)
Someone misunderstood "make a donation in Scanlan's name" for "request a donation in Scanlan's name".
That's weirdly genius.
I love it. Send more requests for Sam to give other people money.
I will donate, and I'll tweet about it.
Jasmine Riegel in Germany, I read your long--
Riegel?
Riegel.
R-I-E-G-E-L?
R-I-E-G-E-L.
That's me! This is my kincharkunen person! I don't know.

It's a beautiful handwritten letter, which I won't read on air, but we're going to pass it around to everybody because we have so many letters, but thank you, I read the whole thing during the stream.

Are we still on french horns?
Yeah, we are.
It never ends.

I've got a letter here, it says, "Hi Matt, I just wanted to write to you and say thank you for doing such a great job dungeon mastering Critical Role. I wanted to send you something, but I felt the best thing I could do-- " I know, trust me, "is send you these three dice. As you can see, they've seen better days, but I started playing Dungeons & Dragons back in 1980, with basic D&D, so they've seen a lot of use, and the other three are missing somewhere in some dark dungeon.|They're older than you, and I hope you'll get some joy from this oldtimer's first dice. Thank you for making my hobby so loved, from David Carter," who has-- oh! Legit original, when you had to fill the numbers by scratching in the crayon dice! Let me tell you, these have seen some rolling because when these first came out of the box, they were jagged as shit. They were pointed and could take out your flesh. That is awesome! This is old school d10, d12, and d6-- oh, dude. The d4s were caltrops. Straight up, you could throw them behind you and evade. Yeah, it was amazing. That's so cool! David, thank you so much! These are actually going to go onto my personal onscreen use set.|Thank you. (laughs) Who's up next?

We got sent-- Marisha, Ashley, and Matt got sent some art from Steven-- Lexime, I believe? I'm not entirely sure; I mispronounce my own name.|For Marisha, there are some princesses, apparently. Marisha has some princesses.
Oh, cool!

For Matt, we've got a cowboy.

And something else--
(high-pitched voice) It's high noon!
And then, sadly, this is for Ashley, but I guess she's not around right now.
Ooh, she's going to love this. We have a lot of cool Spider-Gwen stuff at the house.

This is the princesses as Avatar mashup.|As benders, which I'm so about. I remember this series. I remember seeing it on Tumblr when it came out.
Yeah, they have a continuation of it here as well, which is awesome.
This is pretty fucking awesome. Thank you so much!
This is a really cool thing.

"Laura, my husband and 12-year-old daughter are crazy about Critical Role. They're now playing D&D every Sunday with a small group here in Reno, Nevada. We thought of you when my ten-year-old was selling items for a fundraiser at school, and we hope you enjoy 'Trinket's Peanut Butter Bears!'"
Whoa, give them to me!
What? How? And also, they made a donation to My Friend's Place, which is my charity that I love.
That's great!
I'm sorry. I've had some wine.
Thank you Andrew and Grace and Ashley and Michelle! Thank you, all of you. Sorry. What are you doing? What did you do? What are you doing?
Nothing, a close up of the booze that Travis was trying to open. The camera keeps finding it! (laughter)

That is awesome. Thank you so much!
Thank you so much!
Thank you!

Give me these Peanut Butter Bears!
What's next?

On a Wednesday?
Because that velcro neon was so flattering to begin with.
I know.

I definitely want a bear!
Sam, would you like a bear?
I'll have a bear.

What I thought when I came in tonight-- what we were missing for Critmas, it was more Nelly Furtado.

Are those the graphic novels we spilled wine on at the top of the show?
Yes, they are.
We added a splash of color.

That's awesome!
Yeah. They're from Momlan.

I will take wine.
There's a lot of porn in there.
They're really good. My mom's husband is a prolific author, and that is male genitalia right there. Brian, I'm sorry.
For what? I have male genitalia.
Well...
Or I used to, before I went to that soft, smooth surface, which is way easier now. It's great when TSA pulls me aside. I go, "Grab it all! There's nothing."
It's called Billy Budd KGB, if anyone wants to pick it up. Jerome Charron.

So this is from Justin Sharp, who sent a tweet to us a while ago. I don't know if you guys remember, but his daughter had just been diagnosed with cancer.
